item.description:
"Improving Decision Making:
Interdisciplinary Lessons from the Natural and Social Sciences"

Friday, April 17, 2009
Time to be determined
Radcliffe Gymnasium, 10 Garden Street, Radcliffe Yard, 617-495-8600

This symposium will focus on improving decision making and will bring together neuroscientists, behavioral economists, computer scientists, psychologists, and legal scholars to discuss what we now know about how people make decisions, ways in which context and the framing of decisions may be manipulated to improve decision making, and the possible roles of computer systems for improved decision making.

Panelists include Linda Babcock, Carnegie Mellon University; Eric Horvitz, Microsoft Corporation; Dean Karlan, Yale University; Daria Knoch, University of Zurich, Switzerland; Edmund Rolls, University of Oxford, England; Eldar Shafir, Princeton University; Cass Sunstein, University of Chicago and Harvard Law School; and Leigh Thompson, Northwestern University.

This symposium is supported by the Marjorie Cabot de Enriquez Fund.
item.name: Sciences: Natural & Social
